intro: Argemone squarrosa subsp. squarrosa, commonly known as the desert castor or squarrosa pricklypoppy, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, characterized by its spiny branches and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in dryland gardens.
